Messages.Author: Guillermo Gallego
Messages.Content: Dear all,  As discussed yesterday and announced at the beginning of the course, we will have the exam on the last week of lectures. We proposed the Tuesday time slot (July 16th, 10:15 am - it is written on ISIS). If you cannot make it on this day, please let me know as soon as possible. Next week we are discussing the stereo depth estimation paper. This will conclude the theory part of the course. The final exam will cover Ex 6, 7 and the theory from Contrast Maximization to the stereo paper, excluding the discussion of the monocular paper EMVS. I can also ask about general things, like what is an event camera, what is a time surface representation (since we use it in Ex 7), etc. Best regards, Guillermo

Messages.Author: Florian Fleischmann
Messages.Content: I keep getting the same error because i seem to walk out of the image when updating image_warped.  How is the distance delta x and delta y supposed to be scaled to get a "fractional distance"? In Exercise 2 we used the binsize, but what is the maximal distance here?

Messages.Author: Guillermo Gallego
Messages.Content: The "bin size" in an image is 1 pixel. The fractional distance delta is a number in [0,1].  Could it be that you are indexing the coordinates in the opposite way? OpenCV expects image_warped->at(yy, xx) not (xx,yy).  Best, Guillermo
